intro: Phyllanthus benguetensis, commonly known as the Benguet phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in forest understories and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a rough texture. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
